for_sales.sales_text:
Successful racing and cruising yacht. John Leather design, built 1966. Decks, combings and interior all replaced by current owner in 2000. Sale now due to other boating commitments. LOA 25ft approx. LOD 21ft approx. Beam 8ft approx. Draft (plate up) 2ft (plate down) 4ft 6 inches.

Hard wood planking on steam bent oak frames. Copper fastened. Plywood epoxy sheathed decks with teak combings and rubbing bands. Iron keel with steel centre plate operated by bronze winch. Transom hung rudder with laminated curved tiller. Two berths in cuddy under foredeck. Two roll out pipe cots in main cockpit. Teak thwart and sole boards.

Rig: hollow spruce mast (built 2004) sitting in stainless steel tabernacle with raising and lowering gear. Pine boom and gaff with hollow spruce yard for top sail. Hollow spruce bowsprit. Stainless steel rigging on lanyards. Furlex furling gear for jib on bowsprit. All controls led back to front of cockpit on bronze belaying pins. Running backstays on bronze Highfield levers. Banks bi-radial jib, two staysails. Mainsail and topsail by Doyle sails. Two reefs in main and battens in leach. Large asymmetric for light wind cruising or racing led back to turning blocks aft on bronze pad eyes. Bronze mainsheet horse and water sail. Four bronze self-tailing winches on combings.

Instruments: Echo sounder and log with compass between. Magellan chart plotter.

Electrical: Twin bilge pumps either side of centre box. Autopilot. Two bronze lights at forward end of cockpit and two lights in cuddy. Port, starboard and stern navigation lights with masthead tricolour and combined anchor light. Battery isolation switch in lazarette.

Engine: Yanmar 1 GM, water pump rebuilt in 2014 driving two bladed propeller. 5 gallon stainless steel fuel tank. Recently antifouled and painted.

Additional equipment: Full camping cover supported by hoops also doubles as sprayhood or sun awning. Mainsail cover and full cockpit cover.

"Blue Gansey" has cruised extensively as far south as Douarnenez (Brittany) and has made numerous Channel crossings. She has raced successfully in Solent Old Gaffers’ events claiming many prizes including outright winner of the Yarmouth Old Gaffers Festival race and second overall in 2015.

Comes with original paperwork and drawings. Located afloat on the River Itchen in Southampton.

boat.name: Blue Gansey
boat.short_description: Blue Gansey was rebuilt by Ian MacGillivray in 2000. She is regularly sailed across the English Channel to French festivals, even though she is an open boat.
